title: I've been getting more trolls recently, and I don't know why?
body: I thought trolls were over with when I heard about Riot slowly getting up a system for reports. Suddenly I had 4 games in a row with verbal abuse. Maybe trolliness rises with Elo because newer players are always kinder...

replies.body:
Umm, who was the support in this game?
I know that it was a normal game, but still.
Also you and him had 100 CS by 30 mins, thats pretty terrible.
Ignoring him and just reporting is the way to go, but Ryze can farm and split push easy so Im kinda shocked you only got 100.
It was first time in normals and i had no experience in ability spam champs... I ended up refunding

Yeah you have about only 300 games in total.
When you learn to CS like 80-100 every ten mins (Apart from supporting)
thats when you will notice a vast improvement.

Slowly learn every champion too if you can. I spent months playing every champion in the game at least twice so I knew what they do/did.

But i do get 75 - 105 cs in 10 mins at most games, sometimes a bit under and sometimes a bit over depending on the champs auto attack. I just wasnt used to ryzes AA compared to Anivia and i ended up AAing too early

Usually i get RoA at 10-14 mins

Thing is, trolls will never be "over with". They're always going to exist and no system, automated or manual, will be able to completely remove them from any game (rather, from any community). At times you may notice barely any and at other times you may notice a whole lot more, everyone experiences it. It's likely just one of those times where you're being matched with more people who are inclined to troll and you'll probably start noticing less at some point.

Difference is Titanfall is a pay to play game, League of Legends it free to play. It's significantly harder for someone to just make a new account for a pay to play game than a free to play game, for LoL it takes all of 5 minutes (including making a new email account). While such a system would have an effect on **individual accounts** the players themselves would do what they already are and just make a new account. Not to mention, not all "toxic" players are even identified by the punishment systems, some of them do slip through (and that's part of what I mean when I say no system will completely remove them). While it's a good idea for a pay to play or subscription game it wouldn't be effective for LoL.
